issue.title: SPXSpeechSynthesizer stopSpeaking() method cannot return immediately on iOS 17

labels.name: accepted
labels.description: Issue moved to product team backlog. Will be closed when addressed.

issue.body:
After calling SPXSpeechSynthesizer startSpeakingSsml() to synthesize the speech, while the speech is playing back, and then call stopSpeaking() to stop the speech, stopSpeaking() cannot return immediately on iOS 17. The speech audio can be stopped immediately, but this method will take 10-20 secs to return. 

iOS16 and iOS 15 doesn't have this issue.

Below is our sample swift code to illustrate this issue on iOS 17

// below is the code snippet to start text to speech




```
let speechConfig = try SPXSpeechConfiguration(subscription: key, region: region)
synthesizer = try SPXSpeechSynthesizer(speechConfig)

let ssml = """
<speak version="1.0" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2001/10/synthesis"  xmlns:mstts="https://www.w3.org/2001/mstts" xml:lang="en-US">
    <voice name="en-US-JennyNeural">
        <mstts:express-as style="friendly">
            <prosody rate="1.0">
                Hello how are you ?
            </prosody>
        </mstts:express-as>
    </voice>
</speak>
"""

try synthesizer?.startSpeakingSsml(ssml)

```




Below is the code snippet to stop text to speech

```
try synthesizer?.stopSpeaking() // this method takes 10-20s to return
```

We're using MicrosoftCognitiveServicesSpeech-iOS ver 1.32.1

comment.body:
Desperately need this fix too!
Not just the stopSpeaking, but also the stopContinuousRecognition() is taking much longer to return.

issue.title: [Unity] error SPXERR_MIC_NOT_AVAILABLE when using not using the default microphone
issue.body:
**Describe the bug**

I'm using the Speech Recognition service in my Unity app, and the user has the ability to pick a microphone. However, I'm getting the following error when using anything other than an empty string as the microphone name.

```
ApplicationException: Exception with an error code: 0xe (SPXERR_MIC_NOT_AVAILABLE)
Microsoft.CognitiveServices.Speech.Internal.SpxExceptionThrower.ThrowIfFail (System.IntPtr hr) (at <d0ceedf3fb224537bf09e708a3e455fc>:0)
Microsoft.CognitiveServices.Speech.Recognizer.FromConfig (Microsoft.CognitiveServices.Speech.Recognizer+GetRecognizerFromConfigDelegate fromConfig, Microsoft.CognitiveServices.Speech.SpeechConfig speechConfig, Microsoft.CognitiveServices.Speech.Audio.AudioConfig audioConfig) (at <d0ceedf3fb224537bf09e708a3e455fc>:0)
Microsoft.CognitiveServices.Speech.SpeechRecognizer..ctor (Microsoft.CognitiveServices.Speech.SpeechConfig speechConfig, Microsoft.CognitiveServices.Speech.Audio.AudioConfig audioConfig) (at <d0ceedf3fb224537bf09e708a3e455fc>:0)
```

It's worth mentioning that the other microphones work without any problems, so the devices are available.

**To Reproduce**

My code is based on [this sample](https://github.com/Azure-Samples/cognitive-services-speech-sdk/blob/master/samples/csharp/unity/speechrecognizer/Assets/SpeechSDKSample/Scripts/SpeechRecognition.cs#L145) on this repository, with the exception I have an `AudioConfig`. This is the relevant part of the code.
```csharp
audioConfig = AudioConfig.FromMicrophoneInput(micDeviceName ?? "");
speechRecognizer = new SpeechRecognizer(speechConfig, audioConfig);
```

**Expected behavior**

Be able to get speech transcriptions from any microphone available.

**Version of the Cognitive Services Speech SDK**

1.32.1

**Platform, Operating System, and Programming Language**

 - OS: Windows 11
 - Hardware - x64, x86
 - Programming language: C#
 - Unity 2022.3.11f1

issue.title: iOS SDK x2 times binary size growth
issue.body:
## Description

I'd like to open an issue to track the problem of the **x2** binary size growth of SDK for iOS. 

MicrosoftCognitiveServicesSpeech => 1.26.0 == 5.9 Mb binary size (arm-64)

MicrosoftCognitiveServicesSpeech => 1.32.1 (latest) == 12.7 Mb binary size (arm-64)

We are looking forward to your team to resolve the issue since it is a blocker for us to update SDK to the latest version.

comment.body:
Hi there,

It is true that the SDK has grown in size and right now unfortunately there is no way to reduce it. There may be work in the future to reduce the size, but currently it is unplanned.

issue.title: Speech To Text Batch Transcription Support for more formats
issue.body: Currently it looks like the Batch transcribe feature supports only mp3, ogg and wav formats. The issue is we record calls in MS Teams and the format is mp4. Could you please add the functionality to transcribe from mp4? If not, are there any alternatives. We do not want to leave the azure cloud to perform transcoding if possible as the data could be of a sensitive nature.

comment.body:
Yes, there are several NuGet packages that can extract audio from an MP4 file. Here are a few options:

1. **[FFMediaToolkit 4.5.1](https://www.nuget.org/packages/FFMediaToolkit/)**¹: This is a cross-platform audio/video processing library based on FFmpeg native libraries. It supports audio/video frames extraction, reading file metadata, and encoding media files from bitmap images and audio data¹.

2. **FFMpegCore 5.[1](https://www.nuget.org/packages/FFMediaToolkit/).0**²: This is a .NET Standard FFMpeg/FFProbe wrapper for easily integrating media analysis and conversion into your .NET applications. It supports both synchronous and asynchronous calls API². You can use the `FFMpeg.ExtractAudio` method to extract the audio track from a video file².

Please note that you should check the compatibility of these packages with your project's .NET version before using them.

issue.title: Speech To Text Batch Transcription Support for more formats
issue.body: Currently it looks like the Batch transcribe feature supports only mp3, ogg and wav formats. The issue is we record calls in MS Teams and the format is mp4. Could you please add the functionality to transcribe from mp4? If not, are there any alternatives. We do not want to leave the azure cloud to perform transcoding if possible as the data could be of a sensitive nature.

comment.body: Unfortunately the teams transcripts are having accuracy issuez for us so we wanted to pass in the actual audio to check if the batch transcripts faired better. We would not want to pass the data out of the azure cloud due to security reasons. Any good nuget pkgs?

issue.title: Speech To Text Batch Transcription Support for more formats
issue.body: Currently it looks like the Batch transcribe feature supports only mp3, ogg and wav formats. The issue is we record calls in MS Teams and the format is mp4. Could you please add the functionality to transcribe from mp4? If not, are there any alternatives. We do not want to leave the azure cloud to perform transcoding if possible as the data could be of a sensitive nature.

comment.body:
Hi there,

mp4 is a multimedia format which may or may not contain audio. It won't be directly supported by the SDK anytime soon. The only alternative would be to have some sort of converter running in an azure function or something like that. You could then write the output to some azure blob storage.

There is a way to turn on transcription for the meetings that stores it with the video though:
https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/office/view-edit-and-manage-video-transcripts-and-captions-3cb9acb6-05b2-4f59-a50d-7df61123aa20#bkmk_how-captions-and-transcripts-are-stored
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/meeting-transcription-captions

Does that solve your problem?

We do not want to leave the azure cloud to perform transcoding if possible as the data could be of a sensitive nature.

issue.title: Be able to access cognitive-services-speech-sdk  / API inside docker container
issue.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
Reference from: https://github.com/Azure-Samples/cognitive-services-speech-sdk/issues/174

I am surprised Azure have this limitation of not able to let users access the speech sdk / rest api in a container. The only solution available is to run the actual azure speech language model in a container that requires a ridiculous amount of minimum hardware requirement to run.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
be able to access cognitive-services-speech-sdk / REST API inside a docker container

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
using competitor text-to-speech services

comment.body:
yes, running the speech_synthesis.py (using the same key & region) directly on my Lubuntu 22.04 desktop will return speech voice, but if running it in a container, it produces the above error message. The image/container is built from the dockerfile you provided above.

It's the same situation in Lubuntu 20 too, but the image/container is not from your dockerfile.

issue.title: Be able to access cognitive-services-speech-sdk  / API inside docker container
issue.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
Reference from: https://github.com/Azure-Samples/cognitive-services-speech-sdk/issues/174

I am surprised Azure have this limitation of not able to let users access the speech sdk / rest api in a container. The only solution available is to run the actual azure speech language model in a container that requires a ridiculous amount of minimum hardware requirement to run.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
be able to access cognitive-services-speech-sdk / REST API inside a docker container

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
using competitor text-to-speech services

comment.body:
In this instance "peer" means "Another machine in the packet flow path" could be an egress router, ingress router, load balancer, etc...

To try and localize that a bit and make sure I understood correctly... If you run the same python on the machine running the docker container against the same region, it works correctly?

issue.title: When I run the Unity sample on an Android phone, I get an error that the .so file unable to lookup.
issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
When I run the Unity sample on an Android phone, I get an error message "Failed to load native plugin: Unable to lookup library path for 'Microsoft.CognitiveServices.Speech.core.so'".

**To Reproduce**
https://github.com/Azure-Samples/cognitive-services-speech-sdk/tree/master/quickstart/csharp/unity/from-microphone
↑
I built this sample project and ran it on an Android phone.
push "Recognize!"button.

Cognitive Services Speech SDK version : Microsoft.CognitiveServices.Speech.1.32.1.unitypackage
Android phone : Galaxy S20+ 5G
Android OS version : 13
Unity version : 2020.3.36.f1

**Additional context**
I have confirmed that there is a .so file in the lib folder within the apk file.
